titleStmt.title: The Journals of the Lewis and Clark Expedition Online
Part 6: Baling Invoices
titleStmt.author: Gary E. Moulton

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Nebraska Press and University of Nebraska Libraries–Electronic Text Center

bibl.author: Meriwether Lewis
William Clark
bibl.title: The Journals of the Lewis and Clark Expedition, Volume 3
August 25, 1804–April 6, 1805

geoDecl.note: No location. Various invoices to be given to Native American chiefs.

revisionDesc.change: 2016-010-06 Brian Pytlik Zillig Converted from P4 to P5.
2016-09-26 Karin DalzielAdded Geo Information from spreadsheet

div.p: The following lists appear on pp. 256–74 of Codex C, reading backward; the hand is unknown. The first part is an invoice of presents to be given to Indian chiefs, the second lists "necessary stores" for the expedition. There seems to be no way of determining when the lists were written, but since they are found in a journal sent back from Fort Mandan they are printed here.

table.head: Baling Invoice of Sundries for Indian Presents

row.cell: for first Chiefs of Ottos or Panis—

1st Chief of Ponkas or any other
that may be met this Side of
Mahar—

this part intended for foreign
nations— Should any of the
three above Nations be met; the
presents of Small articles may be
taken from the Bags no. 33, 15,
42, 9, 36, 16, 45 or 26—
by ½ pce. to young women
No 15 The Same—(Chief dress for Rickaras) & one Flag
" 42 The Same—Ditto for Mandanes & a Flag of 2d size

" 45 The Same, except no Scarlet Britch Clouts blue ones in lieu, and no large
medals for 1st Chiefs, But medals of 2d sise—& no Scarlet Blanket, but 1 Shirt in
lieu & a Flag 2d Sise
" 36 The Same as "no 45" & a Flag of 2d Size
" 16 The Same Do & a Flag of 3d Sise

" 26 The Same Do (a flag of 3d sise) & No 9 (a Flag of 3d Sise) these two Bales
have artillery Coats

div.p: Two Carrots of Tobacco will be Added to every 1st Chief Dress, and 1 Carrot to the 2nds & 3ds— and 6 Carrots to to be given to the Nation—
The followg. Bales intended for foreign Nations: that is those beyond the mandanes

row.cell:
to Some Young Chiefs or
Chiefs Sons
2 dos: Small hawk Bells & 2 Gro: do

No 3 The Same, Except the followg. articles more— vt. [viz.] 1 Gorget, 1 medal,
1d vermillion, 1 Bunch Bells, 3 hair pipes, 1 Burng. glass, 1 necklace & 1 remnant
of Scarlet—. and the followg. article, less— vt. [viz.] 1 Arm & Wrist Band, 1
Bunch Yellow Beads & 1 Callico Shirt
2 Bundles of Pieces of Brass & Iron

div.p: In a Box of necessary Stores No. 8 are the follg. belongg. to Indian Department 27 fish Spears 5 large Canoe Awls

table.head:
Recapitulation of the Above fourteen Bags & 1 Box of Indian Presents.
Vizt [viz.]—

row.cell: Chief Coats (of which 9 are Artillery Coats)
Dos: Knives, of which 22 doz Butchers Knives
⅓ Doz: large Sise hawk Bells
Collars of Brass Wire, quill Sise
fathoms of Red flannel in 12 pieces— to a piece of flannel
Bundles of pieces of Brass & Iron

table.head: Bailing Invoice of Sundries, being necessary Stores Vizt. (viz.]

row.cell: tin Boxes; with 2 memm. Books in Ea.
The Same, except 1 p. trowsers less and 1 flannel Shirt in lieu
" 6 The Same, except 1 watch Coat less & 3 Cloth overalls, 2 pr ox hide Shoes, ½ m fish hooks, & 1 Gro: awls more.—

table.head: Recapitulation of Seven Bales & 1 Box of necessy Stores Vit. [viz.]
